docs.snippet: President Donald Trump said Thursday he didn't know about the $130,000 payment his personal attorney made to Stormy Daniels, issuing a firm denial in his first public comments about the adult-film actress who alleges she had an affair with him.

headline.main: Trump Says He Didn't Know About Payment to Stormy Daniels
headline.print_headline: Trump Says He Didn't Know About Payment to Stormy Daniels

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump, engaged in an escalating confrontation with Beijing over trade, will urge Latin American leaders next week to work with the United States - not China - on trade, a senior U.S. official said on Thursday.

headline.main: Trump to Urge Latam to Look to U.S., Not China, on Trade: Official
headline.print_headline: Trump to Urge Latam to Look to U.S., Not China, on Trade: Official

docs.snippet: U.S. President Donald Trump signed a memorandum on Friday ordering the end of a policy, known as "catch and release," in which illegal immigrants are released from detention while awaiting a court hearing on their status.

headline.main: Trump Signs Memo Ending 'Catch and Release' Immigration Policy
headline.print_headline: Trump Signs Memo Ending 'Catch and Release' Immigration Policy

docs.snippet: U.S. President Donald Trump and Abu Dhabi Crown Prince Sheikh Mohammed bin Zayed of the United Arab Emirates agreed on Friday to push for unity among Gulf nations, the White House said, amid a bitter standoff between Qatar and other U.S. allies in...

headline.main: Trump, UAE Leader Push for Unity in Gulf as Dispute Drags On
headline.print_headline: Trump, UAE Leader Push for Unity in Gulf as Dispute Drags On

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump is accusing the Justice Department of "slow walking" its release of documents related to the FBI's handling of the Hillary Clinton email investigation.

headline.main: Trump Says Justice Dept 'Slow' to Fill Republican Demands
headline.print_headline: Trump Says Justice Dept 'Slow' to Fill Republican Demands

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump is hoping to counter Chinese efforts to bolster its economic influence in the Americas during his inaugural trip to Latin America next week amid an escalating trade fight and his harsh rhetoric on immigration.

headline.main: Trump to Visit Latin America Amid Trade, Immigration Fights
headline.print_headline: Trump to Visit Latin America Amid Trade, Immigration Fights

docs.snippet: U.S. President Donald Trump blasted the World Trade Organization on Thursday, saying the international trade body was "unfair" to the United States while giving China "tremendous perks and advantages," but he offered no evidence or examples to bac...

headline.main: Trump Says U.S. Treated Unfairly vs China at WTO: Tweet
headline.print_headline: Trump Says U.S. Treated Unfairly vs China at WTO: Tweet

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump said on Thursday he would take a look into ethics allegations against Environmental Protection Agency Administrator Scott Pruitt over his condo lease and other issues, but added the official was doing a "fantastic job."

headline.main: Trump: Pruitt Has Done 'Fantastic' Job, Will Look Into Ethics
headline.print_headline: Trump: Pruitt Has Done 'Fantastic' Job, Will Look Into Ethics

docs.snippet: When President Donald Trump made a congratulatory phone call to Russian leader Vladimir Putin, White House chief of staff John Kelly wasn't on the line.

headline.main: 'Tired of Being Told No,' Trump Freezes Out Chief of Staff
headline.print_headline: 'Tired of Being Told No,' Trump Freezes Out Chief of Staff

docs.snippet: The Latest on President Donald Trump and immigration (all times local):

headline.main: The Latest: Trump Wants Military to Secure US-Mexico Border
headline.print_headline: The Latest: Trump Wants Military to Secure US-Mexico Border
